channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: We asked, you answered: Let's make a toast to the ways you keep calm and carry on
item.description: Our readers responded to our callout, sharing the strategies they use to lift their spirits in the face of setbacks and woes. And yes, one way is: A jam happy face on toast!
item.content:encoded: Our readers responded to our callout, sharing the strategies they use to lift their spirits in the face of setbacks and woes. And yes, one way is: A jam happy face on toast!
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: A mix-up over bioengineered tomato seeds sparked fears about spread of GMO crops
item.description: An organic seed company was distressed to learn it had marketed a GMO purple tomato by mistake. The incident raised alarm about the impact of new GMO plants.
item.content:encoded: An organic seed company was distressed to learn it had marketed a GMO purple tomato by mistake. The incident raised alarm about the impact of new GMO plants.
item.dc:creator: Sasa Woodruff

item.title: These dreamy photos of historical Cairo will transport you to another time
item.description: Photographer Nour El Massry captures ethereal images of Egyptian landscapes, interiors and architecture in one of the world's largest megacities.
item.content:encoded: Photographer Nour El Massry captures ethereal images of Egyptian landscapes, interiors and architecture in one of the world's largest megacities.
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: The Louvre Museum looks to rehouse the 'Mona Lisa' in its own room â€” underground
item.description: Louvre Director Laurence des Cars said her institution is looking at upgrading both the visitor experience surrounding the iconic painting as well as the museum overall.
item.content:encoded:
Louvre Director Laurence des Cars said her institution is looking at upgrading both the visitor experience surrounding the iconic painting as well as the museum overall.

(Image credit: Marc Piasecki)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Gaza protestors picket White House correspondents dinner, as Biden ribs Trump
item.description: The war in Gaza spurred large protests outside a glitzy roast with President Joe Biden, journalists, politicians and celebrities Saturday but went all but unmentioned by participants inside.
item.content:encoded:
The war in Gaza spurred large protests outside a glitzy roast with President Joe Biden, journalists, politicians and celebrities Saturday but went all but unmentioned by participants inside.

(Image credit: Terrance Williams)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Harvey Weinstein hospitalized after his return to New York from upstate prison
item.description: Harvey Weinstein's lawyer said that the onetime movie mogul has been hospitalized for tests after his return to New York City following an appeals court ruling nullifying his 2020 rape conviction.
item.content:encoded:
Harvey Weinstein's lawyer said that the onetime movie mogul has been hospitalized for tests after his return to New York City following an appeals court ruling nullifying his 2020 rape conviction.

(Image credit: John Minchillo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump VP contender Kristi Noem responds to backlash over story about killing her dog
item.description: The Republican South Dakota governor details what she says was a tough decision to shoot an "untrainable" family dog in a forthcoming memoir. Animal rights advocates and Democrats decried the move.
item.content:encoded:
The Republican South Dakota governor details what she says was a tough decision to shoot an "untrainable" family dog in a forthcoming memoir. Animal rights advocates and Democrats decried the move.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Bernie Sanders says Netanyahu is attacking campus protests to deflect war criticism
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu criticized ongoing campus protests across the U.S. as antisemitic. The Vermont senator said it was an attempt to "deflect attention" from Israel's actions.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu criticized ongoing campus protests across the U.S. as antisemitic. The Vermont senator said it was an attempt to "deflect attention" from Israel's actions.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Hamas releases video of a second American being held hostage in Gaza
item.description: Hamas has released a video showing two captives, one of them an American, as part of an effort to prove that the two men are still alive. It was the second video of a U.S. citizen released this week.
item.content:encoded:
Hamas has released a video showing two captives, one of them an American, as part of an effort to prove that the two men are still alive. It was the second video of a U.S. citizen released this week.

(Image credit: Manu Fernandez)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Hamas says it's preparing to respond to Israel's latest Gaza cease-fire proposal
item.description: The militant group says it's examining the latest Israeli suggestions for a cease-fire in Gaza, seven months into the conflict that has claimed tens of thousands of lives.
item.content:encoded:
The militant group says it's examining the latest Israeli suggestions for a cease-fire in Gaza, seven months into the conflict that has claimed tens of thousands of lives.

(Image credit: Ahmad Hasaballah)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx
